data.enText: a rough written version of sth that is not yet in its final form

data.chText: 我已经写好这封信的草稿。
data.enText: I've made a rough draft of the letter.
This is only the first draft of my speech.
the final draft (= the final version)

data.chText: 这条法规还只是项草案。
data.enText: The legislation is still in draft form .

data.chText: 宪法 / 条约 / 协议草案

data.enText: a written order to a bank to pay money to sb

data.chText: 付款必须用英国银行承兑的汇票。
data.enText: Payment must be made by bank draft drawn on a UK bank.

data.chText: 运动员选拔制（某些职业运动队每年在大学生中选拔新队员）
data.enText: a system in which professional teams in some sports choose players each year from among college students

data.chText: 你关上门好吗？这里有穿堂风。
data.enText: Can you shut the door? There's a draft in here.
to write the first rough version of sth such as a letter, speech or book

data.chText: 起草宪法 / 合同 / 法案

data.enText: I'll draft a letter for you.
to choose people and send them somewhere for a special task

data.chText: 现正在另外抽调警察去控制人群。
data.enText: Extra police are being drafted in to control the crowds.
They were drafted into the army.

means: 运动员选拔制(某些职业运动队每年在大学生中选拔新队员)
（设计、草图、提纲或版本）正在起草中的，草拟的

tr: the act of moving a load by drawing or pulling

example: he finished it at a single gulp

tr: a preliminary sketch of a design or picture
a regulator for controlling the flow of air in a fireplace
the depth of a vessel's keel below the surface (especially when loaded)
any of the various versions in the development of a written work
example: the final draft of the constitution

tr: a serving of drink (usually alcoholic) drawn from a keg
a current of air (usually coming into a chimney or room or vehicle)
a document ordering the payment of money
drawn by one person or bank on another
engage somebody to enter the army
draw up an outline or sketch for something

value.def: A draft is an early version of a letter, book, or speech.

example.ex: I rewrote his rough draft, which was published under my name...
example.tran: 我把他的草稿重新改写，并以我的名字发表了。

example.ex: I faxed a first draft of this article to him.
example.tran: 我将这篇文章的初稿传真给他了。

example.ex: ...a draft report from a major US university.
example.tran: 美国一所重点大学的报告初稿

value.def: When you draft a letter, book, or speech, you write the first version of it.

example.ex: He drafted a standard letter to the editors...
example.tran: 他起草了一份给编辑的标准信函。

example.ex: The legislation was drafted by House Democrats.
example.tran: 法律由众议院民主党草拟。

value.def: If you are drafted, you are ordered to serve in the armed forces, usually for a limited period of time.

example.ex: During the Second World War, he was drafted into the US Army...
example.tran: 二战期间，他应征加入了美国陆军。

example.ex: He wasn't drafted for the war; he volunteered for the Navy.
example.tran: 他不是因为这次战争才被征召入伍的，他是自愿加入海军的。

value.def: If people are drafted into a place, they are moved there to do a particular job.

example.ex: Extra police have been drafted into the town after the violence...
example.tran: 暴乱过后又有警力被抽调到了该镇。

example.ex: The manager will make a special plea to draft the player into his squad as a replacement.
example.tran: 主教练将特别要求抽调这位运动员到他的队里做替补。

value.def: The draft is the practice of ordering people to serve in the armed forces, usually for a limited period of time.
A draft is a written order for payment of money by a bank, especially from one bank to another.

example.ex: The money was payable by a draft drawn by the home...
example.tran: 这笔钱可凭国内承兑的汇票支付。

example.ex: Ten days later Carmen received a bank draft for a plane ticket.
example.tran: 10 天后卡门收到了一张用于购买机票的银行汇票。
